physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient 1 had significant findings including short stature, mild central hypothyroidism, severe GH deficiency, and structural abnormalities on MRI revealing anterior pituitary hypoplasia and an absent pituitary stalk.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1's growth velocity improved from baseline after the initiation of growth hormone therapy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI revealed a thin corpus callosum and cavum septum pellucidum. Patient 2 experienced growth and developmental delay.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By 20 months of age, MRI indicated a small anterior pituitary and an absent pituitary stalk with an ectopic posterior pituitary.
